Race.SpecificTitle: Assessor -- For Regular and Unexpired Term
PW Police Jury (Vet.) -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp. - PJ
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  To authorize an exemption from ad valorem tax in Calcasieu Parish, in addition to the homestead exemption, of the next seven thousand five hundred dollars of the assessed valuation of property receiving the homestead exemption which is owned and occupied by a veteran with a service-connected disability rating of one hundred percent and to provide for matters related thereto.
Race.FullText: Shall an exemption from ad valorem tax be authorized in Calcasieu Parish, in addition to the homestead exemption, on the next seven thousand five hundred dollars of the assessed valuation of property receiving the homestead exemption which is owned and occupied by a veteran with a service-connected disability rating of one hundred percent; to authorize the exemption to apply to the surviving spouse of a deceased veteran if the exemption was in effect on the property prior to the death of the veteran and the surviving spouse remains the owner of the property; to require the taxing authority to absorb any decrease in the total amount of ad valorem taxes collected as a result of this exemption; to prohibit the exemption from creating any additional tax liability for other property taxpayers; and to prohibit implementation of the exemption from triggering reappraisal of property or adjustment of millages, all as authorized by statewide passage of Constitutional Amendment No. 3 of 2010, which also provides that this exemption shall extend and apply in the parish and become effective only after the question of its adoption has been approved by a majority of the registered voters of the parish voting in an election held for that purpose?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Lake Charles -- Authorize lease of property
Race.SummaryText:
City of Lake Charles Proposition

Summary:  Authority for the City of Lake Charles to lease lakefront property located in the area designated as tract One D for commercial use as the National Hurricane Museum and Science Center, in accordance with LA. R.S. 33:4699.1 C, as follows: (aa) Area of Land - A portion of Tract One D consisting of approximately 2.7 acres, more or less, including adjacent water bottoms of up to 4.2 acres more or less; (bb) General Nature and Extent of Proposal - A museum facility consisting of approximately 63,000 square feet with approximately 26,000 square feet of exhibit space, approximately 100 seat theatre, a cafe', a lobby, and related support and administrative facilities; (cc) Anticipated Costs/Public Funds to be Used - The anticipated costs of the facility is $65 million which will be funded by a combination of private donations and some public funds. The City of Lake Charles has committed $4,800,000 to the project; and, (dd) Lease Terms - City will lease to the National Hurricane Museum and Science Center, Inc., for a term of fifty (50) years rent free.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Lake Charles be allowed to lease city owned lakefront property in the area designated as Tract One D for commercial use as the National Hurricane Museum and Science Center as set forth herein?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Iowa -- 1/2% Sales Tax - TC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Town of Iowa Proposition
(1/2% Sales Tax Renewal)

Summary:  One-half (1/2%) sales tax renewal for 10 years beginning July 1, 2012, with collections from the levy of the tax estimated to be $250,177 for one entire year, to be used for the following purposes: flood control maintenance and improvements; economic development activities; capital improvements and maintenance to the Town Hall and Town Park situated in the Town of Iowa.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Iowa, Louisiana (the "Town") pursuant to Article VI, Section 29 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to continue to levy and collect a sales and use tax of one-half percent (1/2%) (the "Tax"), previously authorized at an election held on April 6, 2002, for an additional ten (10) years beginning July 1, 2012, upon the sale at retail, use, lease or rental, consumption and storage for use or consumption of tangible personal property and on sales of services within the Town, all as presently or hereafter defined in La. R.S. 47:301 to 47:317, inclusive, with collections from the levy of the Tax estimated to be $250,177 for one entire year, with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) to be dedicated and used for the following purposes: flood control maintenance and flood control improvements; economic development activities; capital improvements and maintenance to the Town Hall and Town Park situated in the Town of Iowa?

Race.SpecificTitle: ComntyCtr&PlygDist 3 of Wd 7 -- 3 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Community Center and Playground District No. Three of Ward Seven Proposition

Summary:  Renew, levy and collect three (3) mill ad valorem property tax for Community Center and Playground District No. Three of Ward Seven running from January 1, 2012 to December 31, 2021 for the purpose of maintaining the District swimming pool, and related facilities in the District (Ward 7 of Calcasieu Parish).  The District expects to collect $160,911.00 from said tax in 2012.
Race.FullText: Shall Community Center and Playground District No. Three of Ward Seven of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to renew, levy and collect, an ad valorem property tax of three (3) mills on all the property subject to taxation within the District for a period of ten (10) years beginning on January 1, 2012 and ending December 31, 2021, for the purposes of maintaining the District swimming pool, and related facilities? The District estimates that it will collect $160,911.00 from the levy of the tax in the year 2012.

Race.SpecificTitle: ComntyCtr&PlygDist 4 of Wd 1 -- 10 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Community Center and Playground District No. Four of Ward One Proposition

Summary:  Authority for Community Center and Playground District No. Four of Ward One of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana, to renew, levy and collect a ten (10) mill capital improvement and maintenance ad valorem tax for ten (10) years beginning January 1, 2013 for operating, acquiring, constructing, improving, extending and maintaining public recreational services and facilities within the District.  The District expects to collect $536,113.00 from said tax in 2013.
Race.FullText: Shall Community Center and Playground District No. Four of Ward One, of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana, renew, levy and collect a ten (10) mill capital improvement and maintenance ad valorem tax on all taxable property not to exceed ten (10) years beginning January 1, 2013 to be used for the purpose of operating, acquiring, constructing, improving, extending and maintaining public recreational services and facilities within the District?  The District estimates that it will collect $536,113.00 from the levy of the tax in the year 2013.

Race.SpecificTitle: GDD No. Seven of Wd. Eight -- 5 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Gravity Drainage District No. Seven of Ward Eight Proposition

Summary:  Authority for Gravity Drainage District No. Seven of Ward Eight of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana, to renew, levy and collect a five (5) mill property tax for a period of ten (10) years beginning January 1, 2012 for maintaining, constructing and improving drainage works within the territorial limits of the District.  The District expects to collect $170,845.00 from said tax in 2012.
Race.FullText: Shall Gravity Drainage District No. Seven of Ward Eight, of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana, be authorized to renew, levy and collect a tax, in addition to any other tax, of five (5) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation in said District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021 for the purpose of maintaining, constructing and improving drainage works constituting works of public improvement within the territorial limits of the District?  The District estimates that it will collect $170,845.00 from the levy of the tax in the year 2012.

Race.SpecificTitle: Iowa FPD #1 of Wd. 8 Prop#1 -- 5 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs. (hydrants)
Race.SummaryText:
Iowa Fire Protection District No. One of Ward Eight Propositions
Proposition No. 1

Summary:  Authority for Iowa Fire Protection District No. One of Ward Eight of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana, to renew, levy and collect a five (5) mill ad valorem property tax for ten (10) years beginning January 1, 2012 for maintaining, operating and developing fire protection facilities within the territorial limits of the District.  The District expects to collect $49,580.00 from said tax in 2012.
Race.FullText: Shall Iowa Fire Protection District No. One of Ward Eight, of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana, be authorized to renew, levy and collect a five (5) mill ad valorem property tax on all taxable property not to exceed ten (10) years beginning January 1, 2012 to be used for the purpose of maintaining, operating and developing fire protection facilities, purchasing and repairing fire trucks and other fire fighting equipment, and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection, including charges for fire hydrant rental and service all within the territorial limits of the District?  The District estimates that it will collect $49,580.00 from the levy of the tax in the year 2012.

Race.SpecificTitle: Iowa FPD #1 of Wd. 8 Prop#2 -- 5 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Iowa Fire Protection District No. One of Ward Eight Propositions
Proposition No. 2

Summary:  Authority for Iowa Fire Protection District No. One of Ward Eight of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana, to renew, levy and collect a five (5) mill ad valorem property tax for ten (10) years beginning January 1, 2012 for maintaining, operating and developing fire protection facilities within the territorial limits of the District. The District expects to collect $49,580.00 from said tax in 2012.
Race.FullText: Shall Iowa Fire Protection District No. One of Ward Eight, of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana, be authorized to renew, levy and collect a five (5) mill ad valorem property tax on all taxable property not to exceed ten (10) years beginning January 1, 2012 to be used for the purpose of maintaining, operating and developing fire protection facilities, and for purchasing and repairing fire trucks and other fire fighting equipment, all within the territorial limits of the District?  The District estimates that it will collect $49,580.00 from the levy of the tax in the year 2012.

Race.SpecificTitle: Sulphur Parks & Recreation -- 10.25 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Sulphur Parks and Recreation Proposition
(Maintenance Millage Renewal)

Summary:  Authority for Sulphur Parks and Recreation, formerly known as Community Center and Playground District No. Two of the Parish of Calcasieu, Louisiana to renew, levy and collect a 10 year maintenance tax not exceeding ten and twenty-five one hundredths (10.25) mills for the purpose of maintaining and operating the District's public buildings, community centers and golf courses, and for paying the cost of constructing and improving recreation facilities within the District. The District expects to collect $4,729,381.00 from said tax in 2013.
Race.FullText: Shall Sulphur Parks and Recreation, formerly known as Community Center and Playground District No. Two of the Parish of Calcasieu, Louisiana, renew, levy and collect a tax not exceeding 10.25 mills for a period not to exceed ten (10) years beginning January 1, 2013, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating public buildings, community centers and golf courses within the District, including all equipment necessary thereto, title to which shall be in the public? The District estimates that it will collect $4,729,381.00 from the levy of the tax in the year 2013.
